TEXT: The applicant is a NORP citizen , born in DATE and living in GPE , GPE . She is represented before the ORG by PERSON PERSON , chairman of an association for patients .

Since DATE the applicant has suffered from various health problems , e.g. arrhythmia , blood pressure , headaches , and pain in her back and neck . In DATE , she sought compensation from her insurance company on the basis of a voluntary insurance claiming her problems were related to her work as a dentist .

On DATE , the insurance company refused her claim for compensation . ORG ( tapaturmalautakunta , olycksfallsnämnd ) and ORG ( vakuutusoikeus , försäkringsdomstol ) rejected her appeals on DATE and DATE respectively . ORG ( korkein oikeus , högsta domstolen ) refused her leave to appeal on DATE . These proceedings are later referred to as “ the first set of proceedings ” .
After receiving new medical statements , the insurance company reviewed the applicant ’s claim for compensation and , on DATE , upheld its previous refusal .
The applicant appealed to ORG , which rejected the appeal on DATE . The proceedings before ORG were conducted in writing .

The applicant appealed to ORG requesting , inter alia , an oral hearing . ORG received a statement from the insurance company and the applicant submitted her observations to it . On DATE , ORG rejected the appeal without holding an oral hearing . It reasoned its refusal to hold an oral hearing as follows :

The applicant sought leave to appeal against ORG decision from ORG arguing , inter alia , that ORG had no legal ground for its refusal to hold an oral hearing . Furthermore , she claimed that ORG should wait for ORG decision on her complaint before deciding the case . On DATE , ORG refused the applicant leave to appeal . The latter proceedings are later referred to as “ the second set of proceedings ” .

According to Section CARDINAL , subsection CARDINAL , of ORG ( laki vakuutusoikeudesta , lagen om försäkringsdomstolen CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) as in force at the relevant time , the proceedings before ORG were written . However , ORG could for special reasons decide to hold an oral hearing where the parties , witnesses and experts could be heard . It could also request that evidence be taken by an ordinary court of first instance .

According to Section CARDINAL(b ) of LAW ( tapaturmavakuutuslaki , lagen on olycksfallsförsäkring CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) , one who wants to appeal against ORG decision to ORG must seek leave to appeal , which can be granted under the provisions set out in LAW , Section CARDINAL , of LAW ( oikeudenkäymiskaari , rättegångsbalk ) .
According to LAW , LAW , of LAW , ORG may , when necessary , hold an oral hearing , where the parties , witnesses and experts may be heard , and other evidence may be taken .
